analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have decreased sharply across the UK over the last four years. The -66.2% change compared to a change of -48.5% in all AS-Level entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in art and design subjects in 2017 as did so across all AS-Level subjects. A total of 21.5% of pupils achieved A grades in art and design subjects compared to 23.8% for all subjects.

Entries in biology have decreased sharply across the UK over the last four years. The -63.2% change compared to a change of -48.5% in all AS-Level entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a smaller proportion of students achieved the top grades in biology in 2017 compared to all AS-Level subjects. A total of 18.0% of pupils achieved A grades in biology compared to 23.8% for all subjects.

Entries in all subjects have decreased by 48.5% across the UK over the last four years.

Across the UK, 23.8% of pupils achieved A grades in all subjects in 2017.
